block.p: Miriam Eve Heller, the daughter of Dr. Lynne E. Heller and Rabbi Zachary I. Heller of Newton Centre, Mass., is to be married today to Jonathan Eric Stern, the son of Meryl and Lawrence Stern of Beverly Hills, Calif. The bride's father is to officiate, and her brother, Rabbi Joshua Z. Heller, will take part in the ceremony, at Congregation Mishkan Tefilah in Chestnut Hill, Mass.

The bride and the bridegroom, both 24, graduated summa cum laude from Brandeis University, where the bride was a Justice Brandeis scholar and the editor in chief of The Justice, the student newspaper.

Heller of Newton Centre, Mass., is to be married today to Jonathan Eric Stern, the son of Meryl and Lawrence Stern of Beverly Hills, Calif. The bride's father is to officiate, and her brother, Rabbi Joshua Z. Heller, will take part in the ceremony, at Congregation Mishkan Tefilah in Chestnut Hill, Mass.

The bride and the bridegroom, both 24, graduated summa cum laude from Brandeis University, where the bride was a Justice Brandeis scholar and the editor in chief of The Justice, the student newspaper.

The bride was until last month a program assistant at the Mandel Foundation, an organization in New York that sponsors training programs for executives of nonprofit and educational institutions. In September, she is to begin studying at Stanford University for a Ph.D. in social science education policy and practice.

Her father is the associate director of the Wilstein Institute of Jewish Policy Studies in Brookline, Mass. From 1989 to 1994, he was the president of the World Council of Conservative/Masorti Synagogues. Her mother, a freelance teacher and lecturer on Bible studies, taught this year at Hebrew College and the Ma'ayan Institute, both in Boston.

The bridegroom is a law student at the University of California at Berkeley. His mother is the chief executive of Associated Social Resources, a placement service for social workers, and his father is a partner in Mallery & Stern, a law firm, both in Los Angeles.
